question.text: What does a Statutory Off Road Notification (SORN) tell DVLA?

explanation.text: By making a SORN, DVLA will know that this vehicle is being kept off the public road and does not need vehicle excise duty to be paid. Once you have made a SORN, it remains valid until you tax, sell or scrap the vehicle.

answer.text: That your vehicle is being used on the road but the MOT has expired
That you no longer own the vehicle
That your vehicle is not being used on the road
That you are buying a personal number plate
